website_summaries.verdict: If you're a side-sleeper or just don't like mummy-style bags, consider this envelope-style down sleeping bag.
pros: Made of warm 800 fill power goose down
Outer shell made of iFlex15D Nylon with DWR, high-density down-proof weave
cons: Challenging to pack up after use

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I went with this bag because I wanted an alternative to a mummy bag. Kept me warm in mid 40s with no wind under tarp. I paired this with the hood sold thru wind hard a subsidiary of aegismax. They seem to be made for each other. Packs down like their mummy bags into a very compact stuff sack. Packing into stuff sack is a chore, but it can certainly be done. Can be ventilated thru footend or cinched closed. Comes with large storage bag. Definitely backpacking worthy for me.
customer_reviews.author: Cliftonology

customer_reviews.title: Too good to be true
customer_reviews.text: The bag seemed like it was going to be exactly what I wanted, then it fell apart on the first wash and the company will not respond. Can not recommend buying anything from them. I am a fairly experienced backpacker, I thought I could save a little money on my bag (and I hate mummy bags) because it was more about materials then design, I forgot about workmanship, even on something basic like stitching. Save yourself the hassle and get a good bag
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: great bag, great price.
customer_reviews.text: i’ve has this bag for over a year now. admittedly i’m not a frequent hardcore backpacker anymore, but i’ve used it camping several times and on a few ski bus trips and it’s held up very nicely and keeps me very warm (i’m extremely cold-natured...older, skinny, female). i haven’t been terribly careful with it and wash it almost every time i use it (mild detergent, dry it with dryer balls) and i’ve had no issues. i’m a little on the fence about the drawstring bottom but i can live with it. i do have a silk liner that i’ve used in very cold weather (for me that means teens and 20’s), but again...i’m cold-natured.
customer_reviews.author: RAS64

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on 15+ backpacking trips. Ive used it in both hammock and tent camping. This bag has kept me warm in the teens at night. I am 6'2" with broad shoulders and this bag fits me fine without feeling constricted. I have stacked this bag inside another 0 degree bag I own and have camped in -10 F with it. Another option for you winter campers. Zippers work great. Thought about buying one for my wife! Would recommend as a great economy bag.
customer_reviews.author: mnfishbro

customer_reviews.title: ... foot tall I found this bag to be a perfect fit. The quaolity is equal to it's much ...
customer_reviews.text: At 6 foot tall I found this bag to be a perfect fit. The quaolity is equal to it's much more expensive competitors. On top of a good sleeping pad it kept me warm in 20 F degree temps.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Down settles to corners quickly, very lightweight. Would not use this bag below 40 degrees F without additional blankets.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Rickard

customer_reviews.title: Nice loft, plenty of room to side sleep, light and packs down to 10"x6".
customer_reviews.text: I just got it so I will add to this review after my 8 day bike packing trip. Three layers of packaging to protect the bag during shipping. Arrived on April 2 when the ETA was April 5-26!!!! Stitching looks great. Smooth no snag zippers. I'm a 5'9" side sleeper with my knee at 90 deg angle, bag gives plenty of room to toss around. I was concerned about the gold color but I find that it looks great in person. Definitely glad I bought this larger bag instead of the smaller 80$ Aegis bag.
customer_reviews.author: Cyclist

customer_reviews.title: Really nice bag
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6' and about 190, and this bag is perfect for super light summer mountain motorcycle camping, or backpacking. It packs down super small, is very light, and uses super high quality down and materials/stitching. Zipper is good too. My old camp 7 down mummy bag was too tight in the foot box, as I've got older - need a little more room. This one is great! I got the large, and would recommend that for any guy. It comes to my shoulder (so would need to wear a beanie if it was cold). I'd say if you slept with some fleece, and a down jacket, you might be ok with this bag to about freezing.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Herbst

customer_reviews.title: They underestimate the temp rating and super light weight!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first review ever but I thought this needed to be said. This bag is amazing. I shaved around 1.5 pounds with my old Kelty Cosmic down sleeping bag and it keeps me warmer! They underestimate the temp rating. I slept with this in 15 degree weather in a van and stayed toasty expect my face which froze. This bag is great for shaving weight. Id say still bring a quilt for your hammock if it is winter time to keep your butt warm. Great buy though, totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Danifaz

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these to replace our synthetic 30 degree bags. I have always wanted a down bag but the high prices of brand name bags have kept me from purchasing.... these things are wonderful.. super light ..super compressible. So I don’t have a brand name bag to compare this to but all I can say it’s warmer lighter and smaller than my synthetic brand name bag ...... and cost less
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy this ! UPDATED REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: OK......I LOVE it.....No smell.....fluffs up fast....mine came fast and with small compression bag and BIG fluff/storage bag....light as a feather...will update after next trip as I just got it ! Here it is in my Gossamer Gear ''The ONE" Tent..WITH THIS QUILT...Super warm.....more loft than my 15 degree Paria Quilt which is awesome and as warm as my Sierra Designs NITRO QUILT 800 / 20 DEGREE.....I start the PCT soon and I am taking this one ! CHEERS.....
customer_reviews.author: Mark Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - Double bag option does not work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a hiking option and chose it over other cheaper down options because the bags were marketed as being able to create/convert a double sleeping bag. Bought two and could not find any way to connect them, the zippers don't fit/work with the second bag. Very disappointed that I spent more than needed for this function.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Combs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!  One great Bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is the buy of the year and I love this bag! Priced right for sure! I'm 6'2" and weight is 250 and I have lots of room in this bag. With a lightweight cocoon liner I would be comfortable in the high teens or low 20's F. I would advise washing it, unless you love the smell of ducks!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Trost

customer_reviews.title: Nice value
customer_reviews.text: Good compromise on cost, weight, and warmth. Down recovered nicely from being tightly packed in the quality stuff sack. Storage bag is nice keeping until you need to pack it back up. The design is consistent with being able to pair them up for a double bag, but I only have one, so cannot confirm.
customer_reviews.author: David MS

customer_reviews.title: but just used this camping over the weekend and was pretty warm when inside of it
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how well it would work out in cold weather, but just used this camping over the weekend and was pretty warm when inside of it, but comfortable in 45-50 degree weather, just laying flat over top while sleeping on a camp cot.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. C.

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, Really warm, real down
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag, worth every dollar. I am a 240lbs 6'4" man and this sleeping bag fully covered me and i was able to zip up around my shoulders. I used it during a winter storm with temps at 14deg. I had to take all my layers down to my base layers because i was so warm.
customer_reviews.author: rokas

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for tent camping in Death Valley this past winter on a cold, windy night and I was very comfortable. It’s a more relaxed shape; more comfortable than my mummy bag. It seems high quality and packs down nice and small. I’m very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jon M. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is great for dry camping. We use it a mostly as a comforter while watching TV in the winter. It is very light and comfortable. It compresses down to a very small size. Great for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Gary D. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Nice all around - except the smell
customer_reviews.text: Great bag so far. It is a bit smelly as other reviewers have mentioned. I tried washing it as soon as I got it, but perhaps need to do it again. As soon as I get a little sweaty in it you can smell the scent of animals. My tentmate said she didn't notice so much, though.
customer_reviews.author: Greg C

customer_reviews.title: Quality bag/reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag at a reasonable price. Haven’t used it much but so far so good. I’m almost tempted to buy a second one to have as a back up. Packs very small. Also very roomy for me (5,7 200lbs). What I like the best is its versatile.
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: Good bag for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Good bag for the price. I bought the XL size. It's good down to 30° or so. Did come with a funky smell initially but I let it air out for a day and it was gone.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: I ordered a second one!
customer_reviews.text: This is going to be an ultra lightweight backpacking game changer. It is for my six year old daughter who carries sone of her own gear now. I ordered a second one for myself too!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Livingston

customer_reviews.title: great product right price
customer_reviews.text: I like this product with cinching abilities on both ends can easily work as a quilt, I slept comfortably down to abt 40 in UT wearing light merino bottoms and socks an long sleeve poly top a merino cap for me was too warm. It can be pretty difficult to get the bag in the stuff sack, I would suggest the manufacture make it just a bit bigger, and let the side compression straps bring it down to pack-ability sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Pinkham

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful and comfortable bag. Although there's no hood, I snuggle down inside and have been completely comfortable. I needed more room than a mummy bag, and this is perfect. It weathered a cold night in the Mojave Desert.
customer_reviews.author: Bugswilson

customer_reviews.title: Great price of a quality goose down bag
customer_reviews.text: I don't think you can beat this price.. Great price of a quality goose down bag. Opens flat, packs small, light weight. Actual 1# 13 oz. Compression bag and larger, home bag.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Lack of down.
customer_reviews.text: Near empty of down filling. Cold spots galore. Gold color is diarrhea brown because you can see through to the other side which is black.
customer_reviews.author: RuggedWaze

customer_reviews.title: Nice economy bag
customer_reviews.text: I had no issue with smells and product performed well over 3 day Smokey trip. Packs down very small. Was not tested yet in cold weather. Only got into the 50’ and used it like a quilt.
customer_reviews.author: Brian hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Bad smell
customer_reviews.text: Had a strong chemical smell that stayed on my hands after handling it, and also on the other item that was shipped in the box with it. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: A.L.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great light weight bag or liner for cold weather bags
customer_reviews.author: Jamesbr80

customer_reviews.title: This bag seriously can't be beaten for the price. ...
customer_reviews.text: This bag seriously can't be beaten for the price. I'm seriously considering buying a second and modifying it to serve as an underquilt.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: happy
customer_reviews.text: Really like the feel color and features this offers.. seems to be good quality
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag, a little tough to get back in the stuff sack but I expected that
customer_reviews.author: curtis

customer_reviews.title: Just buy one
customer_reviews.text: I was questioning this product... but it’s epic. Awesome early season bag.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan  Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag! Great affordable bag that I think gets overlooked. I’ve had mine out at 28 degrees and I was nice and toasty with a good base layer on. I highly recommend this bag!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great summer bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sleeping bag for above 35-40 degrees. I slept in 25-30 degrees for 2 days. The first day just with the bag and a base layer of thermals I was freezing cold. The second day I bought a liner that was rated to give me 20 degrees more to my sleeping bag. The start of the night I was toasty warm and toward the end of the night my feet were freezing cold. I was more comfortable the second night but was not very pleased. Overall the bag is a very great bag for the price and weight. Do recommend for summer and early fall backpacking!
customer_reviews.author: Randy Hammer

customer_reviews.title: I picked up the gold in a large and loved the form factor
customer_reviews.text: I picked up the gold in a large and loved the form factor, but boy did it stink. I live within three miles of several poultry plants and know the smell of rotting bird well. That was the smell. I tried cleaning it following REI's procedures, but the seams burst and I was greeted with some moldy down and an even worse smell. purchased on a competing Chinese website that shall go nameless
customer_reviews.author: Zach Sensabaugh

customer_reviews.title: A Backpacker Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! Purchased for multiple uses...from top quilt, hammock underquilt, sleeping bag and camping throw... Shipping was fast & on time, truly love how light and warm it performs! Added tabs to be attached to my hammock as an underquilt as well and truly love it!
customer_reviews.author: Johnnny...

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned several name brand down bags and this bag is warmer and roomier than any of them.
customer_reviews.author: J. NELSON

customer_reviews.title: Quality product for 1/2 the price!
customer_reviews.text: So far these seem amazing! Ultra lightweight and inside the included compression bag very small! The storage bag is nice and large to protect the down. I got the lg. And small to zip together. They loft up really nicely. I wrapped one around me for a few minutes and it warmed up really fast! Dijon mustard color is not the best lol but for the price this bag cannot be beat! Hopefully i will remember to update after field testing. No weird smell at all in either bag that some other reviewers had an issue with.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

product_meta.title: AEGISMAX UL Goose Down Sleeping Bag Tapered Rectangular Down Sleeping Bag Super Light Backpacking Envelope Down Bag 800 Fill Gold
product_meta.description:
Please know in advance:Manual measurement error 2~5cm.
Temperature rating(EN 13537):
Comfort:+7° C/45° F 
Lower Limit:+2° C/36° F 
Extreme:-12° C/10° F 
Season rating: Indoor/Summer/Spring/Autumn
Insulation type:800 Fill Power 95/5 White Goose Down
Zip options:Regular-left;Large-Right
Fill weights (grams):Regular-400g;Large-450g
Bag weights (grams):Regular-724g;Large-792g
Sleeping bag shape:Tapered rectangular
Fill ratio (top/bottom):55/45
Baffle design:lateral baffles
Shell design:Differential cut shell
Outer shell fabric:iFlex15D Nylon with DWR,high density down proof weave.
Inner fabric:iFlex15D Nylon with skin & soft,high density down proof weave.
Zip Draft Tube:Yes with anti-snag
Neck Draft Tube:Yes
Security Pocket:NO
Zip:YKK5# DU N-ANTI P-TOP REVERSE 
Zip together:Regular and Large can zip together
Fabric size(Inner):Regular-190CM X 78/75in X 31in;Large-200cm X 82cm/79in X 32in
Shrink min size:Regular-183cm X 72cm /72in X 28in;Large-193cm X 75cm/76in X 30in
Recommended Height for User:Regular-175cm/69in;Large-190cm/75in
Chest Circumference:Regular-146cm/57in;Large-167cm/66in
Hip Circumference:Regular-130cm/51in;Large-150cm/59in
Foot Circumference:Regular:98cm/38in;Large:104cm/41in
Compression sack volume:Regular and Large:Diameter:18cm/7in Height:40cm/16in;Vol.max/min:10L/3.3L
Note:
Temperature scale is for reference only,may vary due to the using environment, using methods and user'sphysical condition,
To avoid unnecessary trouble or danger,please make an accurate estimate before outdoor using.
Tips:
Please wash by hand in cold water with neutral soap, hard scrubbing is prohibited.Let it air-dry in the sun,instead of hand wringing .
To keep the down decompressed,please store it in the white storage bag which is included in package when not using.
feature_bullets: COMFORTABLE:800 filling power goose down and great soft skin fabric,keep you warm and comfortable all night.
Sleeping bag shape:Tapered rectangular; Baffle design:lateral baffles
Fabric:15D Nylon with high density down proof weave.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
